summary: The government spends billions on services every year (such as consulting and engineering services) using various types of contracts. We looked at the government's use of two contract types that are considered higher-risk because contractors bill by the hour. With hourly billing, contractors could conceivably work less efficiently in order to charge more hours. From FYs 2017-2021, the government spent $139 billion on these contracts...
title: Federal Contracting: Opportunities Exist to Reduce Use of Time-And-Materials Contracts
